title.narrative: 004 GENDER EQUALITY AND CHILD RIGHTS POLICY

description.narrative: By 2025, capacity of national entities is strengthened to monitor, report advocate for and align to international child rights and gender equality commitments, which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices (Covid), Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 'By 2025, girls and boys benefit from an enhanced policy, budgetary environment and services that improve their wellbeing

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2025, capacity of national entities is strengthened to monitor, report advocate for and align to international child rightsand gender equality commitments

description.narrative: With UNICEF’s support, MOWSA submitted the 6thand 7thstate report on the CRC in February 2021 and addressed the list of issues from the Committee on the ACRWC pertaining to the 4th and 5th state report submitted in August 2020. The ACRWC committee has reviewed GoE’s report during its November session and is expected to adopt a recommendation. UNICEF contributed to the finalization of theReview of the National Women’s Policy to inform the development of a comprehensive gender equality policy. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:07/01/2022
